spirit:component.spirit:name: design_1_axi_ethernet_0_0

spirit:field.spirit:name: MCSTREJ
spirit:field.spirit:description: Reject Receive Multicast Destination Address. 0 Accept receive multicast destination address Ethernet frames that meet address filtering specified in FMI register and/or the multicast address table. 1 Reject all receive multicast destination address Ethernet frames regardless of FMI register and multicast address table.For each I/O bit programmed as input

spirit:field.spirit:name: BCSTREJ
spirit:field.spirit:description: Reject Receive Broadcast Destination Address. 0 Accept receive broadcast destination address Ethernet frames. 1 Reject all receive broadcast destination address Ethernet frames. This is the only method available for blocking broadcast Ethernet frames.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TXVTAGMODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Transmit VLAN Tag Mode. 00 No VLAN tags are added to transmit frames. 01 VLAN tags are added to all transmit frames. 10 VLAN tags are added to all transmit frames that already have a VLAN tag. 11 VLAN tags are added to select transmit frames that already have VLAN tags.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RXVTAGMODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Receive VLAN Tag Mode. 00 No VLAN tags are added to receive frames. 01 VLAN tags are added to all receive frames. 10 VLAN tags are added to all receive frames that already have a VLAN tag. 11 VLAN tags are added to select receive frames that already have VLAN tags.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TXVSTRPMODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Transmit VLAN Strip Mode. 00 No VLAN tags are stripped to transmit frames. 01 One VLAN tag is stripped from all transmit frames that have VLAN tags. 10 Reserved. 11 One VLAN tag is stripped from select transmit frames that already have VLAN tags.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RXVSTRPMODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Receive VLAN Strip Mode. 00 No VLAN tags are stripped to receive frames. 01 One VLAN tag is stripped from all receive frames that have VLAN tags. 10 Reserved. 11 One VLAN tag is stripped from select receive frames that already have VLAN tags.

spirit:field.spirit:name: NEWFNCENBL
spirit:field.spirit:description: New Functions Enable. 0 Disable new functions. 1 Enable new functions if present.

spirit:field.spirit:name: EMULTIFLTRENBL
spirit:field.spirit:description: Enhanced Multicast Filter Enable. 0 Disable enhanced multicast address filtering mode. 1 Enable enhanced multicast address filtering mode if present.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RXBADFRMEN
spirit:field.spirit:description: Receive Bad Frame Enable. 0 Normal operation, bad frames are rejected. 1 Bad frames are accepted.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TPFV
spirit:field.spirit:description: Transmit Pause Frame Value. These bits denote the value of the transmit pause frame pause time in units of 512 bit times. If enabled by the FCC register, writing a value into this register initiates the transmission of a single pause frame with the pause value defined in this field.

spirit:register.spirit:name: TRANSMIT_IFG_ADJUST_REG
spirit:register.spirit:displayName: Transmit Inter Frame Gap Adjustment Register
spirit:register.spirit:description: Transmit Inter Frame Gap Adjustment Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: IFGP0
spirit:field.spirit:displayName: Transmit Inter Frame Gap Adjustment Value
spirit:field.spirit:description: Transmit Inter Frame Gap Adjustment Value.

spirit:field.spirit:name: HARDACSCMPLT
spirit:field.spirit:description: Hard register Access Complete. 0 Hard register access is not complete. 1 Hard register access is complete.

spirit:field.spirit:name: AUTONEG
spirit:field.spirit:description: Auto-Negotiation Complete. 0 auto-negotiation not complete. 1 auto-negotiation complete.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RXCMPLT
spirit:field.spirit:description: Receive Complete. 0 no frame received. 1 frame received.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RXRJECT
spirit:field.spirit:description: Receive Frame Rejected. 0 no receive frame rejected. 1 receive frame was rejected.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RXMEMOVR
spirit:field.spirit:description: Receive Memory Overrun. 0 normal operation, no overflow occurred. 1 receive Memory overflow occurred and data was lost.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TXCMPLT
spirit:field.spirit:description: Transmit Complete. 0 no frame transmitted. 1 frame transmitted.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RXDCMLOCK
spirit:field.spirit:description: Receive DCM Lock. 0 RX digital clock manager (DCM) not locked. 1 RX DCM Locked.

spirit:field.spirit:name: VID
spirit:field.spirit:description: VLAN identifier. Uniquely identifies the VLAN to which the frame belongs.

spirit:field.spirit:name: UNICASTADDR
spirit:field.spirit:description: Unicast Address.

spirit:field.spirit:name: UNICASTADDR
spirit:field.spirit:description: Unicast Address.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TPID0
spirit:field.spirit:description: TPID Value 0. These bits represent one TPID value that is used for recognizing VLAN frames for both the transmit and receive paths.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TPID1
spirit:field.spirit:description: TPID Value 1. These bits represent one TPID value that is used for recognizing VLAN frames for both the transmit and receive paths.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TPID2
spirit:field.spirit:description: TPID Value 2. These bits represent one TPID value that is used for recognizing VLAN frames for both the transmit and receive paths.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TPID3
spirit:field.spirit:description: TPID Value 3. These bits represent one TPID value that is used for recognizing VLAN frames for both the transmit and receive paths.

spirit:field.spirit:name: LINKSTATUS
spirit:field.spirit:description: Link Status. 0 No Link. 1 Link is up.

spirit:field.spirit:name: LINKSYNC
spirit:field.spirit:description: Link Synchronization. 0 Synchronization failed. 1 Synchronization obtained.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RUDI_C
spirit:field.spirit:description: RUDI(/C/). 0 /C/ ordered sets(AN Configuration sequences) not there. 1 Receiving /C/ ordered sets.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RUDI_I
spirit:field.spirit:description: RUDI(/I/). 0 /I/ ordered sets(Idles) not there. 1 Receiving /I/ ordered sets.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RUDI_INVLD
spirit:field.spirit:description: RUDI(/INVALID/). 0 No invalid data. 1 Receiving invalid data while receiving/C/ or/I/ ordered set.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RXDISPERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: Receive Disparity Error. 0 No running disparity error. 1 Receiving running disparity error during the 8B/10B decoding function.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RXNOTINTABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Receive Not In Table. 0 No receive not in table error. 1 Receiving code group which is not recognized from the 8B/10B coding tables.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PHYLINKSTATUS
spirit:field.spirit:description: PHY Link Status (SGMII only). 0 Indicates that it has not linked with its link partner. 1 Indicates that the PHY has obtained a link with its link partner. When operating in 1000BASE-X mode this bit remains Low and should be ignored.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RMTFLTENC
spirit:field.spirit:description: Remote Fault Encoding (1000BASE-X only). 00 No error, link OK. 01 - Offline. 10 - Link failure. 11 - Auto-Negotiation error. This signal has no significance when the core is in SGMII mode with PHY side implementation and indicates 00.

spirit:field.spirit:name: SPEED
spirit:field.spirit:description: This signal indicates the speed negotiated and is only valid when Auto-Negotiation is enabled. The signal encoding is: 11 - Reserved. 10 - 1000 Mb/s. 01 - 100 Mb/s. 00 10 Mb/s.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DUPLEX
spirit:field.spirit:description: This bit indicates the Duplex mode negotiated with the link partner. 1 - Full-Duplex. 0 - Half-Duplex.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RMTFLT
spirit:field.spirit:description: Remote Fault (1000BASE-X only) 1 - Remote fault is detected. 0 - No remote fault. This signal has no significance in SGMII PHY mode.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_CONF_WORD_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Pause frame MAC Source Address[31:0]. The address is ordered so the first byte transmitted/received is the lowest positioned byte in the register; for example, a MAC address of AA-BB-CC-DD-EE-FF would be stored in Address[47:0] as 0xFFEEDDCCBBAA.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PAUSE_FRM_MAC_SA
spirit:field.spirit:description: Pause frame MAC Source Address[47:32]. Refer the RX_CONF_WORD_0 register description.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CTL_FRM_LEN_CHK_DISABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Control Frame Length Check Disable. When this bit is set to 1, the core does not mark control frames as bad if they are greater than the minimum frame length.

spirit:field.spirit:name: LT_ERR_CHK_DISABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Length/Type Error Check Disable. 1 - Core does not perform the length/type field error checks. 0 - Core performs the length/type field error checks. Normal operation.

spirit:field.spirit:name: HALF_DUPLEX
spirit:field.spirit:description: Half Duplex. 1 - Half Duplex. 0 - Full Duplex.

spirit:field.spirit:name: VLAN_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: VLAN Enable. When this bit is set to 1, VLAN tagged frames are accepted by the receiver.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Receiver Enable. If set to 1, the receiver block is operational. If set to 0, the block ignores activity on the physical interface RX port.

spirit:field.spirit:name: INBAND_FCS_ENBALE
spirit:field.spirit:description: In-band FCS Enable. 1 - MAC receiver passes the FCS field up to the client. 0 - Client is not passed to the FCS. In both cases, the FCS is verified on the frame.

spirit:field.spirit:name: JUMBO_FRAME_ENBALE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Jumbo Frame Enable. 1 - MAC receiver accepts frames over the specified IEEE 802.3-2008 maximum legal length. 0 - MAC only accepts frames up to the specified maximum.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RESET
spirit:field.spirit:description: Reset. When this bit is set to 1, the receiver is reset. The bit then automatically reverts to 0. This reset also sets all of the receiver configuration registers to their default values.

spirit:field.spirit:name: IFG_ADJUST_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Interframe Gap Adjust Enable. If 1, the transmitter reads the value on the port tx_ifg_delay at the start of frame transmission and adjusts the interframe gap following the frame accordingly. If 0, the transmitter outputs a minimum interframe gap of at least twelve clock cycles, as specified in IEEE 802.3-2008.

spirit:field.spirit:name: HALF_DUPLEX
spirit:field.spirit:description: Half Duplex. 1 - Half Duplex. 0 - Full Duplex.

spirit:field.spirit:name: VLAN_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: VLAN Enable. When this bit is set to 1, the transmitter recognizes the transmission of VLAN tagged frames.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Transmit Enable. 1 - Transmitter is operational. 0 - Transmitter is disabled.

spirit:field.spirit:name: INBAND_FCS_ENBALE
spirit:field.spirit:description: In-band FCS Enable. 1 - MAC transmitter expects the FCS field to be passed in by the client. 0 - MAC transmitter appends padding as required, computes the FCS and appends it to the frame.

spirit:field.spirit:name: JUMBO_FRAME_ENBALE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Jumbo Frame Enable. 1 - MAC transmitter sends frames that are greater than the specified IEEE 802.3-2008 maximum legal length. 0 - MAC only sends frames up to the specified maximum.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RESET
spirit:field.spirit:description: Reset. When this bit is set to 1, the transmitter is reset. The bit then automatically reverts to 0. This reset also sets all of the transmitter configuration registers to their default values.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_P0_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: RX Priority 0 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and RX PFC is enabled, reception of a PFC frame with a valid quanta for priority 0 is processed as described in Receiving a PFC Frame When this bit is 0, the rx_pfc_p0_tvalid remains at 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_P1_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: RX Priority 1 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and RX PFC is enabled, reception of a PFC frame with a valid quanta for priority 1 is processed as described in Receiving a PFC Frame When this bit is 0, the rx_pfc_p1_tvalid remains at 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_P2_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: RX Priority 2 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and RX PFC is enabled, reception of a PFC frame with a valid quanta for priority 2 is processed as described in Receiving a PFC Frame When this bit is 0, the rx_pfc_p2_tvalid remains at 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_P3_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: RX Priority 3 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and RX PFC is enabled, reception of a PFC frame with a valid quanta for priority 3 is processed as described in Receiving a PFC Frame When this bit is 0, the rx_pfc_p3_tvalid remains at 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_P4_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: RX Priority 4 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and RX PFC is enabled, reception of a PFC frame with a valid quanta for priority 4 is processed as described in Receiving a PFC Frame When this bit is 0, the rx_pfc_p4_tvalid remains at 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_P5_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: RX Priority 5 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and RX PFC is enabled, reception of a PFC frame with a valid quanta for priority 5 is processed as described in Receiving a PFC Frame When this bit is 0, the rx_pfc_p5_tvalid remains at 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_P6_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: RX Priority 6 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and RX PFC is enabled, reception of a PFC frame with a valid quanta for priority 6 is processed as described in Receiving a PFC Frame When this bit is 0, the rx_pfc_p6_tvalid remains at 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_P7_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: RX Priority 7 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and RX PFC is enabled, reception of a PFC frame with a valid quanta for priority 7 is processed as described in Receiving a PFC Frame When this bit is 0, the rx_pfc_p7_tvalid remains at 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_P0_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX Priority 0 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and TX PFC is enabled, assertion or deassertion of the TX PFC tvalid signal results in a PFC frame being transmitted. When this bit is 0 tx_pfc_p0_tvalid is ignored.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_P1_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX Priority 1 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and TX PFC is enabled, assertion or deassertion of the TX PFC tvalid signal results in a PFC frame being transmitted. When this bit is 0 tx_pfc_p1_tvalid is ignored.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_P2_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX Priority 2 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and TX PFC is enabled, assertion or deassertion of the TX PFC tvalid signal results in a PFC frame being transmitted. When this bit is 0 tx_pfc_p2_tvalid is ignored.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_P3_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX Priority 3 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and TX PFC is enabled, assertion or deassertion of the TX PFC tvalid signal results in a PFC frame being transmitted. When this bit is 0 tx_pfc_p3_tvalid is ignored.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_P4_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX Priority 4 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and TX PFC is enabled, assertion or deassertion of the TX PFC tvalid signal results in a PFC frame being transmitted. When this bit is 0 tx_pfc_p4_tvalid is ignored.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_P5_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX Priority 5 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and TX PFC is enabled, assertion or deassertion of the TX PFC tvalid signal results in a PFC frame being transmitted. When this bit is 0 tx_pfc_p5_tvalid is ignored.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_P6_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX Priority 6 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and TX PFC is enabled, assertion or deassertion of the TX PFC tvalid signal results in a PFC frame being transmitted. When this bit is 0 tx_pfc_p6_tvalid is ignored.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_P7_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX Priority 7 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and TX PFC is enabled, assertion or deassertion of the TX PFC tvalid signal results in a PFC frame being transmitted. When this bit is 0 tx_pfc_p7_tvalid is ignored.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_AUTO_XON
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX Auto XON. Only present when the core has been generated with PFC support this bit defaults to 0 if PFC is not supported. Send a flow control or PFC frame with the relevant quanta set to zero (XON frame) when the relevant, enabled pause request is dropped.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PFC_ENABLE_RX
spirit:field.spirit:description: Priority pause flow control enable (RX). Only present when the core has been generated with PFC support. When this bit is 1, received PFC frames assert the relevant, enabled RX PFC tvalid outputs as described in Receiving a PFC Frame. When this bit is 0, received PFC frames are ignored and passed to the client. This mode should not be enabled at the same time as Flow Control (RX) (Bit[29]).

spirit:field.spirit:name: PFC_ENABLE_TX
spirit:field.spirit:description: Priority pause flow control enable (TX). Only present when the core has been generated with PFC support. When this bit is 1, asserting an enabled TX PFC tvalid signal results in a PFC frame being sent from the transmitter. When this bit is 0,the TX PFC tvalid inputs are ignored. This mode should not be enabled at the same time as Flow Control (TX) (Bit[30]).

spirit:field.spirit:name: FLOW_CONTROL_ENABLE_RX
spirit:field.spirit:description: Flow Control Enable (RX). When this bit is 1, received flow control frames inhibit the transmitter operation as described in Receiving a Pause Frame. When this bit is 0, received flow control frames are always passed up to the client. This mode should not be enabled at the same time as PFC (Bit[25]).

spirit:field.spirit:name: FLOW_CONTROL_ENABLE_TX
spirit:field.spirit:description: Flow Control Enable (TX). When this bit is 1, asserting the pause_req signal sends a flow control frame out from the transmitter as described in Transmitting a Pause Control Frame. When this bit is 0, asserting the pause_req signal has no effect. This mode should not be enabled at the same time as PFC (Bit[26]).

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAC_SPEED_CONF
spirit:field.spirit:description: MAC Speed Configuration. 00 - 10 Mb/s 01 - 100 Mb/s 10 - 1 Gb/s

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_MAX_FRAME_LENGTH
spirit:field.spirit:description: RX Max Frame Length.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_MAX_FRAME_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: RX Max Frame Enable. When Low, the MAC assumes use of the standard 1518/1522 depending upon the setting of VLAN enable. When High, the MAC allows frames up to RX Max Frame Length irrespective of the value of VLAN enable. If Jumbo Enable is set then this register has no effect.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_MAX_FRAME_LENGTH
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX Max Frame Length.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_MAX_FRAME_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX Max Frame Enable. When Low the MAC assumes use of the standard 1518/1522 depending upon the setting of VLAN enable. When High the MAC allows frames up to TX Max Frame Length irrespective of the value of VLAN enable. If Jumbo Enable is set then this register has no effect.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_LATENCY_ADJUST
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX latency adjust value. In ToD mode: This value is in units of nanoseconds and is initialized to reflect the delay following the timestamping position through the MAC, 1000BASE-X FPGA logic, and GTX transceiver components. In Correction Field Format: The default value is 387ns decimal value.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_TS_CORRECTION_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Transmitter Timestamp Correction Enable. 0 - Transmitter timestamp is not adjusted. 1 - Transmitter timestamp is adjusted by the “TX latency adjust value”.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PER_QUANTA_VALUE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Pause Quanta 0 value. This register is only present when PFC is enabled at core customization time. When enabled, this register sets the quanta value to be inserted in the PFC frame for this priority.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PER_QUANTA_REFRESH_VALUE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Pause Quanta 0 refresh value. This register is only present when PFC is enabled at the core customization time. When enabled, this register controls how frequently a PF quanta is refreshed by the transmission of a new PFC frame. When a refresh occurs, all currently active (TX PFC tvalid is High and enabled) priorities are refreshed.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PER_QUANTA_VALUE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Pause Quanta 1 value.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PER_QUANTA_REFRESH_VALUE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Pause Quanta 1 refresh value.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PER_QUANTA_VALUE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Pause Quanta 2 value.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PER_QUANTA_REFRESH_VALUE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Pause Quanta 2 refresh value.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PER_QUANTA_VALUE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Pause Quanta 3 value.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PER_QUANTA_REFRESH_VALUE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Pause Quanta 3 refresh value.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PER_QUANTA_VALUE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Pause Quanta 4 value.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PER_QUANTA_REFRESH_VALUE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Pause Quanta 4 refresh value.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PER_QUANTA_VALUE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Pause Quanta 5 value.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PER_QUANTA_REFRESH_VALUE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Pause Quanta 5 refresh value.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PER_QUANTA_VALUE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Pause Quanta value 6.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PER_QUANTA_REFRESH_VALUE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Pause Quanta 6 refresh value.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PER_QUANTA_VALUE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Pause Quanta 7 value.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PER_QUANTA_REFRESH_VALUE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Pause Quanta 7 refresh value.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PAUSE_QUANTA_REFRESH_VALUE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Pause Quanta refresh value. This register is only present when PFC is enabled at the core customization time. When PFC is supported, the 802.3 pause request can also support XON/XOFF Extended Functionality. This controls the frequency of the automatic pause refresh.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PATCH_LEVEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: Patch Level. 0 - No patch. 1 - Rev1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MINOR_REV
spirit:field.spirit:description: Minor Rev.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAJOR_REV
spirit:field.spirit:description: Minor Rev.

spirit:field.spirit:name: 10M_ABILITY
spirit:field.spirit:description: 10M Ability. If set, the core is 10M capable.

spirit:field.spirit:name: 100M_ABILITY
spirit:field.spirit:description: 100M Ability. If set, the core is 100M capable.

spirit:field.spirit:name: 1G_ABILITY
spirit:field.spirit:description: 1G Ability. If set, the core is 1G capable.

spirit:field.spirit:name: 2G5_ABILITY
spirit:field.spirit:description: 2.5G Ability. If set, the core is 2.5G capable.

spirit:field.spirit:name: STATISTICS_COUNTERS_AVAILABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Statistics Counters available.

spirit:field.spirit:name: HALF_DUPLEX_CAPABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Half duplex capable.

spirit:field.spirit:name: FRAME_FILTER_AVAILABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Frame filter available.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PFC_SUPPORT
spirit:field.spirit:description: PFC Support. This bit indicates that the core has been generated with PFC support.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CLOCK_DIVIDE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Clock Divide.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MDIO_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: MDIO Enable. 1 - MDIO interface can be used to access attached PHY devices. 0 - MDIO interface is disabled and the MDIO signals remain inactive. A write to this bit only takes effect if Clock Divide is set to a nonzero value.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MDIO_READY
spirit:field.spirit:description: MDIO ready. When set the MDIO is enabled and ready for a new transfer.

spirit:field.spirit:name: INITIATE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Initiate. Writing a 1 to this bit starts an MDIO transfer.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_OP
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX_OP. 01 - Write Access. 10 - Read Access.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_REGAD
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX_REGAD. This controls the register address being accessed.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_PHYAD
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX_PHYAD. This controls the PHY address being accessed.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MDIO WRITE_DATA
spirit:field.spirit:description: MDIO Write Data.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MDIO READ_DATA
spirit:field.spirit:description: MDIO Read Data. Valid when MDIO ready is sampled High.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MDIO_READY
spirit:field.spirit:description: MDIO Ready. This is a copy of Bit[7] of the MDIO Control Word.

spirit:register.spirit:name: INTR_STATUS_REG
spirit:register.spirit:description: Indicates the status of an interrupt.

spirit:register.spirit:description: Writing a 1 to any bit of this register clears that particular interrupt.

spirit:field.spirit:name: UNICAST_ADDRESS
spirit:field.spirit:description: Frame filter unicast address[31:0]. This address is used by the MAC to match against the destination address of any incoming frames. The address is ordered so the first byte transmitted/received is the lowest positioned byte in the register; for example, a MAC address of AA-BB-CC-DD-EE-FF would be stored in Address[47:0] as 0xFFEEDDCCBBAA.

spirit:field.spirit:name: UNICAST_ADDRESS
spirit:field.spirit:description: Frame filter unicast address[47:32]. See description for UNICAST_ADDRESS_WORD_0_REG.

spirit:field.spirit:name: FILTER_INDEX
spirit:field.spirit:description: Filter Index. All frame filters are mapped to the same location with the filter index and AVB Select specifying which physical filter is to be accessed. When an AVB filter (bit[8] of the register) is being selected only indexes of 0-2 are allowed.

spirit:field.spirit:name: AVB_SELECT
spirit:field.spirit:description: AVB Select. If the AVB Endpoint is present this is used to indicate that the filter to be selected is one of the three dedicated filters.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PROMISCUOUS_MODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Promiscuous Mode. If this bit is set to 1, the frame filter is set to operate in promiscuous mode. All frames are passed to the receiver client regardless of the destination address.

spirit:field.spirit:name: FILTER_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Filter Enable. This enable relates to the physical frame filter pointed to by the Filter index and take the value of AVB Select into account. If clear, the filter passes all packets.

spirit:field.spirit:name: FILTER_VALUE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Filter Value. All filter value registers have the same format. The lower 31 bits of filter value, at address 0x710, relating to the filter at physical Frame Filter index, that is to be written to the address table. The value is ordered so that the first byte transmitted/received is the lowest positioned byte in the register; for example, a MAC address of AA-BB-CC-DD-EE-FF would be stored in Filter Value[47:0] as 0xFFEEDDCCBBAA.

spirit:field.spirit:name: FILTER_MASK_VALUE

For example, if a basic Destination address comparison was desired then Bits[47:0] should be written to 1 and all other bits to 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: OFFSET_NANOSEC
spirit:field.spirit:displayName: 30-bit offset value for the RTC nanoseconds
spirit:field.spirit:description: 30-bit offset value for the RTC nanoseconds. Used by the microprocessor to initialize the RTC, then afterwards to perform the regular RTC corrections (when in slave mode).

spirit:field.spirit:name: OFFSET_SEC
spirit:field.spirit:displayName: 32-bit offset value for the RTC seconds field
spirit:field.spirit:description: 32-bit offset value for the RTC seconds field. Used by the microprocessor to initialize the RTC, then afterwards to perform the regular RTC corrections (when in slave mode).

spirit:field.spirit:name: OFFSET_SEC
spirit:field.spirit:displayName: 16-bit offset value for the RTC seconds field
spirit:field.spirit:description: 16-bit offset value for the RTC seconds field. Used by the microprocessor to initialize the RTC, then afterwards to perform the regular RTC corrections (when in slave mode).

spirit:field.spirit:name: NANOSEC
spirit:field.spirit:description: RTC Increment Value Control Register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: VAL_RTC_NANOSEC_FIELD
spirit:field.spirit:displayName: Current Value of the synchronized RTC nanoseconds field
spirit:field.spirit:description: Current Value of the synchronized RTC nanoseconds field.

spirit:register.spirit:description: Current RTC Seconds Field Value Bits [31:0]

spirit:register.spirit:name: CURRENT_RTC_SEC_FIELD_VAL_BITS_47_32_REG

spirit:field.spirit:name: VAL_RTC_SEC
spirit:field.spirit:description: Sampled Value of the synchronized RTC Seconds field (Bits[47:32]).

spirit:field.spirit:name: CLEAR
spirit:field.spirit:description: RTC Interrupt Clear Register. Write ANY value to Bit[0] of this register to clear the interrupt_ptp_timer Interrupt signal. This bit always returns 0 on read.

spirit:field.spirit:name: VAL_RTC_NANOSEC_FIELD
spirit:field.spirit:description: RTC Phase Adjustment Register. ns value relating to the phase offset for all RTC derived timing signals (clk8k).

spirit:field.spirit:name: MCSTREJ
spirit:field.spirit:description: Reject Receive Multicast Destination Address. 0 Accept receive multicast destination address Ethernet frames that meet address filtering specified in FMI register and/or the multicast address table. 1 Reject all receive multicast destination address Ethernet frames regardless of FMI register and multicast address table.For each I/O bit programmed as input

spirit:field.spirit:name: BCSTREJ
spirit:field.spirit:description: Reject Receive Broadcast Destination Address. 0 Accept receive broadcast destination address Ethernet frames. 1 Reject all receive broadcast destination address Ethernet frames. This is the only method available for blocking broadcast Ethernet frames.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TXVTAGMODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Transmit VLAN Tag Mode. 00 No VLAN tags are added to transmit frames. 01 VLAN tags are added to all transmit frames. 10 VLAN tags are added to all transmit frames that already have a VLAN tag. 11 VLAN tags are added to select transmit frames that already have VLAN tags.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RXVTAGMODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Receive VLAN Tag Mode. 00 No VLAN tags are added to receive frames. 01 VLAN tags are added to all receive frames. 10 VLAN tags are added to all receive frames that already have a VLAN tag. 11 VLAN tags are added to select receive frames that already have VLAN tags.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TXVSTRPMODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Transmit VLAN Strip Mode. 00 No VLAN tags are stripped to transmit frames. 01 One VLAN tag is stripped from all transmit frames that have VLAN tags. 10 Reserved. 11 One VLAN tag is stripped from select transmit frames that already have VLAN tags.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RXVSTRPMODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Receive VLAN Strip Mode. 00 No VLAN tags are stripped to receive frames. 01 One VLAN tag is stripped from all receive frames that have VLAN tags. 10 Reserved. 11 One VLAN tag is stripped from select receive frames that already have VLAN tags.

spirit:field.spirit:name: NEWFNCENBL
spirit:field.spirit:description: New Functions Enable. 0 Disable new functions. 1 Enable new functions if present.

spirit:field.spirit:name: EMULTIFLTRENBL
spirit:field.spirit:description: Enhanced Multicast Filter Enable. 0 Disable enhanced multicast address filtering mode. 1 Enable enhanced multicast address filtering mode if present.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RXBADFRMEN
spirit:field.spirit:description: Receive Bad Frame Enable. 0 Normal operation, bad frames are rejected. 1 Bad frames are accepted.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TPFV
spirit:field.spirit:description: Transmit Pause Frame Value. These bits denote the value of the transmit pause frame pause time in units of 512 bit times. If enabled by the FCC register, writing a value into this register initiates the transmission of a single pause frame with the pause value defined in this field.

spirit:field.spirit:description: Transmit Inter Frame Gap Adjustment Value.

spirit:field.spirit:description: Receive Memory Overrun. 0 normal operation, no overflow occurred. 1 receive Memory overflow occurred and data was lost.

spirit:field.spirit:description: TPID Value 0. These bits represent one TPID value that is used for recognizing VLAN frames for both the transmit and receive paths.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TPID1
spirit:field.spirit:description: TPID Value 1. These bits represent one TPID value that is used for recognizing VLAN frames for both the transmit and receive paths.

spirit:field.spirit:name: LINKSTATUS
spirit:field.spirit:description: Link Status. 0 No Link. 1 Link is up.

spirit:field.spirit:name: LINKSYNC
spirit:field.spirit:description: Link Synchronization. 0 Synchronization failed. 1 Synchronization obtained.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RUDI_C
spirit:field.spirit:description: RUDI(/C/). 0 /C/ ordered sets(AN Configuration sequences) not there. 1 Receiving /C/ ordered sets.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RUDI_I
spirit:field.spirit:description: RUDI(/I/). 0 /I/ ordered sets(Idles) not there. 1 Receiving /I/ ordered sets.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RUDI_INVLD
spirit:field.spirit:description: RUDI(/INVALID/). 0 No invalid data. 1 Receiving invalid data while receiving/C/ or/I/ ordered set.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RXDISPERR
spirit:field.spirit:description: Receive Disparity Error. 0 No running disparity error. 1 Receiving running disparity error during the 8B/10B decoding function.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RXNOTINTABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Receive Not In Table. 0 No receive not in table error. 1 Receiving code group which is not recognized from the 8B/10B coding tables.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PHYLINKSTATUS
spirit:field.spirit:description: PHY Link Status (SGMII only). 0 Indicates that it has not linked with its link partner. 1 Indicates that the PHY has obtained a link with its link partner. When operating in 1000BASE-X mode this bit remains Low and should be ignored.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RMTFLTENC
spirit:field.spirit:description: Remote Fault Encoding (1000BASE-X only). 00 No error, link OK. 01 - Offline. 10 - Link failure. 11 - Auto-Negotiation error. This signal has no significance when the core is in SGMII mode with PHY side implementation and indicates 00.

spirit:field.spirit:name: SPEED
spirit:field.spirit:description: This signal indicates the speed negotiated and is only valid when Auto-Negotiation is enabled. The signal encoding is: 11 - Reserved. 10 - 1000 Mb/s. 01 - 100 Mb/s. 00 10 Mb/s.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DUPLEX
spirit:field.spirit:description: This bit indicates the Duplex mode negotiated with the link partner. 1 - Full-Duplex. 0 - Half-Duplex.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RMTFLT
spirit:field.spirit:description: Remote Fault (1000BASE-X only) 1 - Remote fault is detected. 0 - No remote fault. This signal has no significance in SGMII PHY mode.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_CONF_WORD_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Pause frame MAC Source Address[31:0]. The address is ordered so the first byte transmitted/received is the lowest positioned byte in the register; for example, a MAC address of AA-BB-CC-DD-EE-FF would be stored in Address[47:0] as 0xFFEEDDCCBBAA.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PAUSE_FRM_MAC_SA
spirit:field.spirit:description: Pause frame MAC Source Address[47:32]. Refer the RX_CONF_WORD_0 register description.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CTL_FRM_LEN_CHK_DISABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Control Frame Length Check Disable. When this bit is set to 1, the core does not mark control frames as bad if they are greater than the minimum frame length.

spirit:field.spirit:name: LT_ERR_CHK_DISABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Length/Type Error Check Disable. 1 - Core does not perform the length/type field error checks. 0 - Core performs the length/type field error checks. Normal operation.

spirit:field.spirit:name: HALF_DUPLEX
spirit:field.spirit:description: Half Duplex. 1 - Half Duplex. 0 - Full Duplex.

spirit:field.spirit:name: VLAN_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: VLAN Enable. When this bit is set to 1, VLAN tagged frames are accepted by the receiver.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Receiver Enable. If set to 1, the receiver block is operational. If set to 0, the block ignores activity on the physical interface RX port.

spirit:field.spirit:name: INBAND_FCS_ENBALE
spirit:field.spirit:description: In-band FCS Enable. 1 - MAC receiver passes the FCS field up to the client. 0 - Client is not passed to the FCS. In both cases, the FCS is verified on the frame.

spirit:field.spirit:name: JUMBO_FRAME_ENBALE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Jumbo Frame Enable. 1 - MAC receiver accepts frames over the specified IEEE 802.3-2008 maximum legal length. 0 - MAC only accepts frames up to the specified maximum.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RESET
spirit:field.spirit:description: Reset. When this bit is set to 1, the receiver is reset. The bit then automatically reverts to 0. This reset also sets all of the receiver configuration registers to their default values.

spirit:field.spirit:name: IFG_ADJUST_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Interframe Gap Adjust Enable. If 1, the transmitter reads the value on the port tx_ifg_delay at the start of frame transmission and adjusts the interframe gap following the frame accordingly. If 0, the transmitter outputs a minimum interframe gap of at least twelve clock cycles, as specified in IEEE 802.3-2008.

spirit:field.spirit:name: HALF_DUPLEX
spirit:field.spirit:description: Half Duplex. 1 - Half Duplex. 0 - Full Duplex.

spirit:field.spirit:name: VLAN_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: VLAN Enable. When this bit is set to 1, the transmitter recognizes the transmission of VLAN tagged frames.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Transmit Enable. 1 - Transmitter is operational. 0 - Transmitter is disabled.

spirit:field.spirit:name: INBAND_FCS_ENBALE
spirit:field.spirit:description: In-band FCS Enable. 1 - MAC transmitter expects the FCS field to be passed in by the client. 0 - MAC transmitter appends padding as required, computes the FCS and appends it to the frame.

spirit:field.spirit:name: JUMBO_FRAME_ENBALE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Jumbo Frame Enable. 1 - MAC transmitter sends frames that are greater than the specified IEEE 802.3-2008 maximum legal length. 0 - MAC only sends frames up to the specified maximum.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RESET
spirit:field.spirit:description: Reset. When this bit is set to 1, the transmitter is reset. The bit then automatically reverts to 0. This reset also sets all of the transmitter configuration registers to their default values.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_P0_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: RX Priority 0 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and RX PFC is enabled, reception of a PFC frame with a valid quanta for priority 0 is processed as described in Receiving a PFC Frame When this bit is 0, the rx_pfc_p0_tvalid remains at 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_P1_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: RX Priority 1 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and RX PFC is enabled, reception of a PFC frame with a valid quanta for priority 1 is processed as described in Receiving a PFC Frame When this bit is 0, the rx_pfc_p1_tvalid remains at 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_P2_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: RX Priority 2 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and RX PFC is enabled, reception of a PFC frame with a valid quanta for priority 2 is processed as described in Receiving a PFC Frame When this bit is 0, the rx_pfc_p2_tvalid remains at 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_P3_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: RX Priority 3 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and RX PFC is enabled, reception of a PFC frame with a valid quanta for priority 3 is processed as described in Receiving a PFC Frame When this bit is 0, the rx_pfc_p3_tvalid remains at 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_P4_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: RX Priority 4 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and RX PFC is enabled, reception of a PFC frame with a valid quanta for priority 4 is processed as described in Receiving a PFC Frame When this bit is 0, the rx_pfc_p4_tvalid remains at 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_P5_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: RX Priority 5 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and RX PFC is enabled, reception of a PFC frame with a valid quanta for priority 5 is processed as described in Receiving a PFC Frame When this bit is 0, the rx_pfc_p5_tvalid remains at 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_P6_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: RX Priority 6 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and RX PFC is enabled, reception of a PFC frame with a valid quanta for priority 6 is processed as described in Receiving a PFC Frame When this bit is 0, the rx_pfc_p6_tvalid remains at 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_P7_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: RX Priority 7 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and RX PFC is enabled, reception of a PFC frame with a valid quanta for priority 7 is processed as described in Receiving a PFC Frame When this bit is 0, the rx_pfc_p7_tvalid remains at 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_P0_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX Priority 0 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and TX PFC is enabled, assertion or deassertion of the TX PFC tvalid signal results in a PFC frame being transmitted. When this bit is 0 tx_pfc_p0_tvalid is ignored.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_P1_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX Priority 1 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and TX PFC is enabled, assertion or deassertion of the TX PFC tvalid signal results in a PFC frame being transmitted. When this bit is 0 tx_pfc_p1_tvalid is ignored.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_P2_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX Priority 2 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and TX PFC is enabled, assertion or deassertion of the TX PFC tvalid signal results in a PFC frame being transmitted. When this bit is 0 tx_pfc_p2_tvalid is ignored.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_P3_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX Priority 3 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and TX PFC is enabled, assertion or deassertion of the TX PFC tvalid signal results in a PFC frame being transmitted. When this bit is 0 tx_pfc_p3_tvalid is ignored.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_P4_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX Priority 4 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and TX PFC is enabled, assertion or deassertion of the TX PFC tvalid signal results in a PFC frame being transmitted. When this bit is 0 tx_pfc_p4_tvalid is ignored.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_P5_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX Priority 5 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and TX PFC is enabled, assertion or deassertion of the TX PFC tvalid signal results in a PFC frame being transmitted. When this bit is 0 tx_pfc_p5_tvalid is ignored.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_P6_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX Priority 6 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and TX PFC is enabled, assertion or deassertion of the TX PFC tvalid signal results in a PFC frame being transmitted. When this bit is 0 tx_pfc_p6_tvalid is ignored.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_P7_PAUSE_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX Priority 7 pause enable. When this bit is 1, and TX PFC is enabled, assertion or deassertion of the TX PFC tvalid signal results in a PFC frame being transmitted. When this bit is 0 tx_pfc_p7_tvalid is ignored.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_AUTO_XON
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX Auto XON. Only present when the core has been generated with PFC support this bit defaults to 0 if PFC is not supported. Send a flow control or PFC frame with the relevant quanta set to zero (XON frame) when the relevant, enabled pause request is dropped.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PFC_ENABLE_RX
spirit:field.spirit:description: Priority pause flow control enable (RX). Only present when the core has been generated with PFC support. When this bit is 1, received PFC frames assert the relevant, enabled RX PFC tvalid outputs as described in Receiving a PFC Frame. When this bit is 0, received PFC frames are ignored and passed to the client. This mode should not be enabled at the same time as Flow Control (RX) (Bit[29]).

spirit:field.spirit:name: PFC_ENABLE_TX
spirit:field.spirit:description: Priority pause flow control enable (TX). Only present when the core has been generated with PFC support. When this bit is 1, asserting an enabled TX PFC tvalid signal results in a PFC frame being sent from the transmitter. When this bit is 0,the TX PFC tvalid inputs are ignored. This mode should not be enabled at the same time as Flow Control (TX) (Bit[30]).

spirit:field.spirit:name: FLOW_CONTROL_ENABLE_RX
spirit:field.spirit:description: Flow Control Enable (RX). When this bit is 1, received flow control frames inhibit the transmitter operation as described in Receiving a Pause Frame. When this bit is 0, received flow control frames are always passed up to the client. This mode should not be enabled at the same time as PFC (Bit[25]).

spirit:field.spirit:name: FLOW_CONTROL_ENABLE_TX
spirit:field.spirit:description: Flow Control Enable (TX). When this bit is 1, asserting the pause_req signal sends a flow control frame out from the transmitter as described in Transmitting a Pause Control Frame. When this bit is 0, asserting the pause_req signal has no effect. This mode should not be enabled at the same time as PFC (Bit[26]).

spirit:field.spirit:name: MAC_SPEED_CONF
spirit:field.spirit:description: MAC Speed Configuration. 00 - 10 Mb/s 01 - 100 Mb/s 10 - 1 Gb/s

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_MAX_FRAME_LENGTH
spirit:field.spirit:description: RX Max Frame Length.

spirit:field.spirit:name: RX_MAX_FRAME_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: RX Max Frame Enable. When Low, the MAC assumes use of the standard 1518/1522 depending upon the setting of VLAN enable. When High, the MAC allows frames up to RX Max Frame Length irrespective of the value of VLAN enable. If Jumbo Enable is set then this register has no effect.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_MAX_FRAME_LENGTH
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX Max Frame Length.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_MAX_FRAME_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX Max Frame Enable. When Low the MAC assumes use of the standard 1518/1522 depending upon the setting of VLAN enable. When High the MAC allows frames up to TX Max Frame Length irrespective of the value of VLAN enable. If Jumbo Enable is set then this register has no effect.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_LATENCY_ADJUST
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX latency adjust value. In ToD mode: This value is in units of nanoseconds and is initialized to reflect the delay following the timestamping position through the MAC, 1000BASE-X FPGA logic, and GTX transceiver components. In Correction Field Format: The default value is 387ns decimal value.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_TS_CORRECTION_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Transmitter Timestamp Correction Enable. 0 - Transmitter timestamp is not adjusted. 1 - Transmitter timestamp is adjusted by the “TX latency adjust value”.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PER_QUANTA_VALUE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Pause Quanta 0 value. This register is only present when PFC is enabled at core customization time. When enabled, this register sets the quanta value to be inserted in the PFC frame for this priority.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PER_QUANTA_REFRESH_VALUE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Pause Quanta 0 refresh value. This register is only present when PFC is enabled at the core customization time. When enabled, this register controls how frequently a PF quanta is refreshed by the transmission of a new PFC frame. When a refresh occurs, all currently active (TX PFC tvalid is High and enabled) priorities are refreshed.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PER_QUANTA_VALUE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Pause Quanta 1 value.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PER_QUANTA_REFRESH_VALUE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Pause Quanta 1 refresh value.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PER_QUANTA_VALUE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Pause Quanta 2 value.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PER_QUANTA_REFRESH_VALUE

spirit:field.spirit:description: Pause Quanta 3 value.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PER_QUANTA_VALUE

spirit:field.spirit:name: PER_QUANTA_VALUE

spirit:field.spirit:name: PAUSE_QUANTA_REFRESH_VALUE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Pause Quanta refresh value. This register is only present when PFC is enabled at the core customization time. When PFC is supported, the 802.3 pause request can also support XON/XOFF Extended Functionality. This controls the frequency of the automatic pause refresh.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MDIO_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: MDIO Enable. 1 - MDIO interface can be used to access attached PHY devices. 0 - MDIO interface is disabled and the MDIO signals remain inactive. A write to this bit only takes effect if Clock Divide is set to a nonzero value.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MDIO_READY
spirit:field.spirit:description: MDIO ready. When set the MDIO is enabled and ready for a new transfer.

spirit:field.spirit:name: INITIATE

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_OP

spirit:field.spirit:name: TX_PHYAD

spirit:field.spirit:description: MDIO Ready. This is a copy of Bit[7] of the MDIO Control Word.

spirit:field.spirit:name: UNICAST_ADDRESS
spirit:field.spirit:description: Frame filter unicast address[31:0]. This address is used by the MAC to match against the destination address of any incoming frames. The address is ordered so the first byte transmitted/received is the lowest positioned byte in the register; for example, a MAC address of AA-BB-CC-DD-EE-FF would be stored in Address[47:0] as 0xFFEEDDCCBBAA.

spirit:field.spirit:name: UNICAST_ADDRESS
spirit:field.spirit:description: Frame filter unicast address[47:32]. See description for UNICAST_ADDRESS_WORD_0_REG.

spirit:field.spirit:name: FILTER_INDEX
spirit:field.spirit:description: Filter Index. All frame filters are mapped to the same location with the filter index and AVB Select specifying which physical filter is to be accessed. When an AVB filter (bit[8] of the register) is being selected only indexes of 0-2 are allowed.

spirit:field.spirit:name: AVB_SELECT
spirit:field.spirit:description: AVB Select. If the AVB Endpoint is present this is used to indicate that the filter to be selected is one of the three dedicated filters.

spirit:field.spirit:name: PROMISCUOUS_MODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Promiscuous Mode. If this bit is set to 1, the frame filter is set to operate in promiscuous mode. All frames are passed to the receiver client regardless of the destination address.

spirit:field.spirit:name: FILTER_ENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Filter Enable. This enable relates to the physical frame filter pointed to by the Filter index and take the value of AVB Select into account. If clear, the filter passes all packets.

spirit:field.spirit:name: FILTER_VALUE
spirit:field.spirit:description: Filter Value. All filter value registers have the same format. The lower 31 bits of filter value, at address 0x710, relating to the filter at physical Frame Filter index, that is to be written to the address table. The value is ordered so that the first byte transmitted/received is the lowest positioned byte in the register; for example, a MAC address of AA-BB-CC-DD-EE-FF would be stored in Filter Value[47:0] as 0xFFEEDDCCBBAA.

spirit:enumeration.spirit:text: Include Shared Logic in IP Example Design

spirit:component.spirit:description: AXI 1G/2.5G Ethernet Subsystem implements a Tri-mode (10/100/1000 Mb/s) Ethernet MAC. This core supports the use of MII, GMII, SGMII, RGMII, and 1000BaseX Interfaces to connect MAC to a PHY chip. It also provides on-chip PHY in case of SGMII and 1000BaseX modes. The MDIO interface is used to access PHY Management registers. This core optionally enables 'TCP/UDP full checksum offload', 'VLAN stripping, tagging, translation' and 'Extended filtering for multicast frames' features. The AXI Ethernet core optionally supports Ethernet Audio Video Bridging (AVB) functions. The core also provide optional IEEE1588-2008 1-step and 2-step hardware time-stamping. This core provides a control interface to internal registers using AXI4-Lite interface. The transmit and receive data interfaces use AXI4-Stream interface. This core optionally supports 2.5G Ethernet.

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: MCAST_EXTEND
spirit:parameter.spirit:displayName: Enable Rx extended multicast address filtering
